questions.question: ………………….. the girl tried her best, she could not get the first rank.
questions.description: We use although to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: The moon …………………….. the stars gives light at night.
questions.description: As well as is similar to both…and. The above can also be expressed as ‘Both the moon and the stars give light at night.’

questions.question: He treated me ………………………….. he had not met me before.
questions.description: We use as if and as though to say what a situation seems like.

questions.question: He screamed ………………………….. he had seen a ghost.
questions.description: We use as if to say what a situation seems like.

questions.question: ……………………………… he felt tired, he sat down to rest.
questions.description: As can indicate the reason for something. It is similar to because.

questions.question: There was ……………………… much noise for me to enjoy the film.
questions.description: There was a lot of noise. I could not enjoy the film. We can express the same idea using too ….to.

questions.question: He borrowed some money from his friends ……………………….. he could buy a car.
questions.description: We use so that to indicate purpose.

questions.question: He offered his daughter a prize ……………………………. she might work hard.
questions.description: We use so that to indicate purpose.

questions.question: The famine was ………………………… severe …………………… very few people survived.
questions.description: We use so that to indicate the purpose or result.

questions.question: It was ……………………….. a hot day that I couldn’t do any work.
questions.description: Such that can mean to such an extent.

questions.question: ………………………. I drop this glass, it will break.
questions.description: We use ‘if’ to express a condition.

questions.question: You must …………………………… complete your work or get someone else to complete it.
